I will be there a bit before and try to get a bigger table.

name: Afterwork drinks

description:
Every Thursday and Saturday, Brussels Art Walk proposes different themes of tours guided by an art expert, art historian or art critic. These tours aim at introducing you to the making of contemporary art and to provide you with tools and information to contextualize art today from the perspective of art history. You would also have the chance to meet the artists and gallery owners.

Please note that you would need to register online here http://www.initiartmagazine.com/BrusselsArtWalk.php and there is a fee to pay on the day (30 euros/pp or 55 euros/couple)

I plan to go next Saturday and I thought maybe some of you might also be interested.

This is not really a meetup organized by me as I cannot guarantee registrations but more a piece of information for those interested. So again - you can RSVP or not, that is not important (unless you want to tell us that you are going and we might meet there) and I cannot guarantee that you'll get a spot, I also do not handle the fees or registration.

If you plan to go it is important that you do register on the organizers' website! (otherwise I guess you won't be able to join the group)

Note that organizers communicate a meeting spot to all those registered via their website. So if some of you decide to join, we'll meet wherever the organizer point us to. Note that for this meetup I indicated the meeting place that is currently on the organizers' website but this may change
name: Brussels Art Walk

description:
Dear all,

The weather forecast for this Sunday is very optimistic - 24 to 26 degrees and sun :)).Therefore I suggest we give it a try and go for a picnic  in the Cinquantenaire Park. If you are like me, you probably don't like getting up early on Sunday :)). Therefore, I suggest we meet later in the afternoon.

To keep it simple I suggest we each bring our own food/drinks and if you want to, something to share with the others. As far as I know there is also a Delhaize supermarket not far from the park which is open on Sundays (but please either double check this or do not count exclusively on this :)

I will also bring badminton equipment hoping I'll find someone interested in playing a game with me and everyone is encouraged to bring whatever they are interested in - bikes, balls, board games etc

If the weather turns out to be not so good, this event will most likely postponed or turned into a "let's have a drink somewhere inside" version.

Also - please note that I really don't appreciate it when people say they would come and they don't show up (and I have a good memory). If you do it more than once I will not give you priority anymore for registering for events - sorry if  it sounds harsh but there are several reasons for this: you are taking the place of someone who might actually want to come; while you may think that one no-show won't be so dramatic, it may be that everyone else thinks the same (it actually happened more than once in Meetup). And I really don't like it when people don't live up to their (small) committments (unless of course something unexpected happens). So if you say you are coming, please come or change your RSVP at least 24h before the meeting time. (otherwise I'm quite relaxed about things :)) Thank you!

See you Sunday!
how_to_find_us: I suggest we meet at 3pm at the main entrance (the one in front of Rue Belliard). We'll wait for 15min there. If you are late call or text me at 0475476354
name: Picnic in the park - Sunday 07 July

description:
Dear all

This is not an usual meetup. I am NOT the organizer but because I think it's a great walk I thought about sharing with you in case you are interested in contemporary art.
Here below you'll find the description provided by the organizers of the event. You can find out more at

You can register for 13 July here http://www.123contactform.com/form-517007/Brussels-Art-Walk-RSVP-Form-13-July-2013

Again - I am not organizing this myself, I do not charge any participation fee and I do not have more details myself. But I am going on 13 July so you won't be alone if you'd like to try it :) I have done it before and it's a great walk!


If you are interested in art,
yet feeling intimidated or confused in front of contemporary art,
or simply not courageous enough to push the gallery doors…
Then, we are here for you!
Every Thursday and Saturday, Brussels Art Walk offers different themes of tours guided by an art expert, art historian or art critic. These tours aim at introducing the public to the making of contemporary art and to provide the participants with tools and information to contextualize art today from the perspective of art history. Participants would also have the chance to meet the artists and gallery owners.
You will find out that Brussels is fun and has a lot of artistic activities to offer!
The participation fee for a usual tour is 30€ per person or 55€ for two (except the special editions to private collections).
name: Brussels Art Walk - Ixelles

description:
Dear all

I have been to several jazz clubs in Brussels but the Music Village is my favourite so far. they usually have great music and I have never been disappointed (been there several times)! However, during July and August they have a special programme with young Belgian musicians playing. And I would like to give it a try.

Next week the Pascal Mohy trio (sax, piano and bass) will pay a tribute to Duke Ellington.

The entrance fee is 10 euros for non-members and 7,50 for members (a drink is offered).

You can check out their website here http://www.themusicvillage.com/

Hope to see you on Wednesday!

NB

Please note that I really don't appreciate it when people say they would come and they don't show up (and I have a good memory). If you do it more than once I will not give you priority anymore for registering for events - sorry if  it sounds harsh but there are several reasons for this: you are taking the place of someone who might actually want to come; while you may think that one no-show won't be so dramatic, it may be that everyone else thinks the same (it actually happened more than once in Meetup). And I really don't like it when people don't live up to their (small) committments (unless of course something unexpected happens). So if you say you are coming, please come or change your RSVP at least 24h before the meeting time. (otherwise I'm quite relaxed about things :)) Thank you!
how_to_find_us: I reserved a table on my name so ask when you pay your entrance fee. you can also text me at 0475476354 in case of emergency.
name: Afterwork Jazz - Wednesday 17 July

description:
Spend an evening making fresh pasta in a lively home setting where you will eat, drink, work out and socialise... all in one evening!
**this event is subject to a fee of 45 euros, please write an email to [masked] to register and receive payment instructions**
When you arrive, you can unwind from your day with a glass of wine and my tasty selection of homemade snacks, chat with the other participants and enjoy the cozy home setting while looking out over beautiful Brussels.
Next, we learn about the traditional Italian art of making pasta at home. I will engage you with the local flavour of real-life stories and tell you all about different pastas and sauces in a fun playful way.
We make pasta dough with my special full-body workout technique which gives great results every time!
Shape, fill and cut your pasta to create the perfect gnocchi and ravioli. You will assemble the filling of the ravioli yourself so you get the feel for the process and taste of your ravioli.
Enjoy a group dinner with your own pasta and my traditional sauces and take the rest home for your family to taste!

No need to take notes, I will send you the recipes for everything we have made and eaten, as well as pictures to have a nice souvenir of the evening.
We will make gnocchi, the famous short fresh pasta with potatoes in the dough, and a kind of ravioli that will leave your mouth watering!
I tasted these ravioli for the first time twenty years ago in the wild and beautiful island of Sardinia. Twenty years later, the dream becomes reality and we will make these lovely treats together, simple and light but surprisingly delicious… no I won’t tell you anything more! After the surprise ravioli, we will make a classic favourite from my region: gnocchi! The ultimate comfort food, they have potato in the dough and can be dressed up with a creamy sauce… or down with a simple tomato sauce that will make your mouth water while respecting your waistline.

The workshop takes place in my apartment, where you will enjoy the fun easy atmosphere of a small group (10 people) in a cozy home setting. Funky homemade apero including wine for everyone will accompany the beautiful food.

Come and make some magic!
name: Make Gnocchi & “Surprise” Ravioli – Funky pasta workshop

description:

description: Dear all, the forecast for Friday is 27 degrees and sun. I suggest we take advantage of what could be one of the last real summer days and relax after a work week with a glass of beer or wine or coke at Le Bar du Matin.
name: Afterwork drinks and sun

description:
Dear all,

I suggest we meet for a beer and some fries from Antoine in place Jourdan.

For those of you who have not yet tried the fries from Antoine - these are supposed to be the best (and greasiest) fries in Brussels. This means that sometimes there are huge queues to get them.

Antoine has a special arrangement with the bars around that you are allowed to eat the fries there with your beer (coke, wine whatever).

So I suggest we meet in place Jourdan, close to Antoine. This will be teamwork. Some of us will queue and others will look for a table in one of the many bars around.

Please do not register if you are hoping that it will not rain on the day and that you won't have to queue in the rain and cold - because this is pretty much what will happen :)). Therefore - only for the brave.

Please do register only if you are sure you'll make it - regardless of the weather - and do change your RSVP if your plans change.

For those of you who are new, I will send an email with details on how you can recognize me closer to the meeting date.
how_to_find_us: if you get lost please text or call 0475476354
name: Afterwork beer and best fries in Brussels - only for the brave

description: Just having dinner, have some drinks and maybe hit the town later on.
how_to_find_us: I will reserve a table - if you can't find us, my cell is 0485 680572
name: Friday evening dinner and drinks

description:
i think this is quite self-explanatory: if u feel like watching this movie come along:)

I think I saw some of you at some other events but for those that I haven't - I will be wearing jeans, a black jacket and a green scarf. I will be waiting outside. We wait about 5 min, then we'll go inside to get tickets. If you have a hard time finding us my mobile is[masked] - but I won't be picking up once the movie is close to starting :)

and yes, we may do a beer afterwards to talk about it but no pressure. let's decide on spot after the movie :)
how_to_find_us: at 18.45 at the cinema entrance in the gallery (fnac also there)
name: Movie night - Her
